result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:22 PM Defendant Miguel Cruz Lopez not in court.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Miguel Cruz Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter.   State requesting warrant but okay to hold.  Warrant authorized to issue on Friday 1:30 pm 09/23/2022.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Waived reading of Information  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.

3:07 PM Defendant Miguel Cruz Lopez in court.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Miguel Cruz Lopez. Interpreter Enrique Soria was sworn and present to interpret.   Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:18 PM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Miguel Cruz Lopez appeared, pro se.  Interpreter Pablo Fulgencio, sworn and appeared by phone.
